title: Amazing Stories is reportedly being rebooted by Hannibal producer Bryan Fuller - US TV
text: It looks like an Amazing Stories reboot may be on the cards.A new version of the 1980s anthology series, which was created and executive produced by Steven Spielberg, is reportedly in development under Hannibal's Bryan Fuller. © Albert L. Ortega/GettyBryan Fuller Entertainment Weekly reports that Fuller will serve as executive producer for the reboot, and will write the pilot script.The original series told hour-long sci-fi and fantasy tells on a weekly basis, with many dubbing it as a family-friendly version of The Twilight Zone. © PA Images / Francois Mori/APSteven Spielberg Directors such as Martin Scorsese, Clint Eastwood and Irvin Kershner (The Empire Strikes Back) alongside Spielberg himself helmed episodes of the show, which received 12 Emmys.However, Spielberg is reportedly not involved in this new version, which is for NBC.Hannibal was recently cancelled, though Fuller may have his work cut out for him as he is also busy with a TV adaptation of Neil Gaiman's American Gods.
